text:
300 ml bottle. (Alko) Helsinki, Finland.
Crystal clear colour with no head. Looks identical to water.
Mild sweetness, soy and mild alcohol in the aroma. 
The flavour is aniseed, mild rice and mild alcohol. Quite easy though. My first Sake review... so please dont count on this...
Bottled, 30 cl. Clear pour. Aroma: Soy, sweat. Taste: Medium sweet. Rice and fruity tones.

Bottled. Pours clear in color with no head. Sweetness in aroma, mostly some honeydew melon and faint hints of herbs or spices. Mild flavor at first, which turns into slightly sweet and peppery spicy in taste later on and ends with a burning warmth of alcohol in aftertaste.

Aroma has wheat, alcohol, anis, herbs. No color, clear, no head. Taste has elements from aroma. Bit oily feel, warming alcohol, herbs in finish which is long and has lots flavor. Feels nice in mouth, flavor and palate work well together., not bad at all.

Sakea almost without colour, no head. Aroma is mix of wheat and fruits, some alcohol, melon. Taste is quite mild, wheat, fruits, cantaloupe, slightly stale taste, alcohol in the aftertaste. Light and fresh to drink. Melony and fresh, slightly diluted flavours.

Bottle at Craigs, Thanks!
Boozy with cheesy wotsits nose, warm and dry finish. Slightly lactic rice pudding.
Bottled at oh6gdxs birthday bash at chrisos. Clear transparent, no retention. Aroma or cardamom and aniseed. Quite fruity with licorice and grains. Salty finish. Quite light.
Bottle at Patrik Birthday Chriso tasting.  Clear.  Its quite dry.  Its ok.  Tasty enough.  Decent sake. Tad harsh on finish

Bottle 300ml. @ [ Tasting by Fin & Loz ].Crystial clear water color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, sweet rice, light alcohol. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet with a long duration, rice, alcohol, licorice notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20111022]
Clear with a nice yeasty, coconut and melon nose. Similar flavours with a warming alcohol linger.
Bottle at fins ... clear ... light viscous swirl...earthy rice ... barest licorice hint nose... oily body ... sweet rice main body... again lightest licorice hint ... some drying alcohol...

300ml bottle. almost colourless, without much fuzz in it. quite clean, mellow sake. easy drinking.  The general character is fruity, pineapple-melon/cantaloupe-wise with the rice, koji backing. Not the most complex of sakes, but a nice light drink.

75 cl bottle, rated on 19.03.2011. Thanks olio!
Aroma has alcohol, some rice and solvent. Flavour has rice, alcohol, sweat and hints of herbs. Somewhat unpleasant finish with alcohol. I have drunk just some sakes, but I think this is a good one.

750 ml bottle @ ISKTR.
Looks like water. Aroma of semen, glue and booze. Flavour of sugar, glue, mold and syrup. Burning alcohol finish. Sake is not my thing.

Bottled (from Alko, Vaasa). Fridge cold. Pale watery see through colour, no head. Aroma is rice, melted rubber and some slight spicy notes as well. Also quite much sweaty shoe aroma in it. Flavour is mild spices, herbs, lightly fruity as well as some ricelike notes. Hides the alcohol very well. 
Room temperatured. Same colour & no head. Aroma stays quite the same but gets the foot sweat stronger and also a stinging alcoholic peak in it. Flavour is quite much the same, but turns a bit more grassyish dry in the front palate. 
At about 70 C. Loses some of the footsweat in aroma, but alcohol comes through a bit better. Flavour gets a slightly alcoholic sting. I probably liked the aroma best when cold, the flavour probably inbetween fridgecold and room temperature.
